description:
Tuvalu shares three Maritime Boundary Treaties with its neighbouring States. The following describes each treaty and its progress.

                     Gazetted and Entered into Force

          Treaty between Tuvalu and France (Wallis and Futuna)
Exchange of notes between the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Government of Tuvalu and the French Embassy in Suva constituting an Agreement concerning provisional maritime delimitation between the two countries, 6 August - 5 November 1985 (entry into force: 5 November 1985; registration #: 25964; registration date: 6 June 1988

           Treaty between Tuvalu and Kiribati
Agreement between Tuvalu and Kiribati concerning their Maritime Boundary, done on 29 August 2012

https://www.un.org/depts/los/LEGISLATIONANDTREATIES/PDFFILES/DEPOSIT/tuv_mzn98_2013_AgreementBetweenTuvaluandKiribati.pdf

                         Signed but Not Entered into Force

           Treaty between Tuvalu and Fiji
Maritime boundary treaty delimitation between Tuvalu and Fiji has been signed but not yet entered into force.
name: Tuvalu Maritime Boundary Treaties
